thread.title: An Insider’s Guide to Fez, Morocco
thread.title_full: An Insider’s Guide to Fez, Morocco - WSJ

author: Gisela Williams
title: An Insider’s Guide to Fez, Morocco
text: MARRAKESH MAY garner more pages and gush in glossy magazines, but traditionalists—and those who romanticize sepia-colored North African cityscapes—tend to put their money on Fez. Founded in the 8th and 9th centuries, and historically the center of learning in the Arab world, Fez, in the foothills of the Middle Atlas mountains, ranks among Morocco’s most rewardingly preserved cities. Its dusty streets lead to faded palaces, hidden gardens and obsessively tiled mosques and madrasas (Islamic centers of study).
